intro: Ceropegia trichantha, commonly known as the African violet or the string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves that are often velvety to the touch, and it thrives in well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. It is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Ceropegia trichantha is also known for its ability to propagate through stem cuttings, making it a favored choice for gardeners and plant enthusiasts.
